[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mTherefore, if we do not fight against the death penalty, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe action of killing people by trial will continue on to later generations[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mDumb on Crime How [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty fails to keep us safe Many law enforcement officials say the death penalty wastes scarce crime prevention resources[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mMoney spent on the death penalty takes away resources from other state needs, especially the needs of the victims of crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe exorbitant costs of capital punishment are actually making America less safe because badly needed financial and legal resources are being diverted from effective crime fighting strategies[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mA May 2004 Gallup Poll found that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma growing number of Americans support a sentence of life without parole rather than the death penalty for those convicted of murder[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWhile [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmost of the free world has abolished the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, many of the states within this country continue to use capital punishment in their criminal justice systems.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m" In fact, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmurder rates in non-death penalty states are lower than murder rates in states with the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, according to the Death Penalty Information Center.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn Connecticut, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty is a false promise that goes unfulfilled, leaving victims' families frustrated and angry after years of fighting the legal system[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m."[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIt does not deter crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, and [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit is extremely expensive to administer[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThey rated [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mexpanded training and more equipment for police officers; hiring more police officers; community policing; more programs to control drug and alcohol abuse; and neighborhood watch programs as more efficient uses of taxpayers' dollars[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m"The DeathPenalty Deterrent or [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255man UNJUST Waste of Life[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m"[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThus, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe safety of society can be assured without using the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m‚Äú[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe death penalty does not work in terms of preventing violent crime and the taking of human life[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m,‚Äù he said.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIf, on the other hand, the death penalty is not in force, convicted persons later found to be innocent can be released and compensated for the time they wrongly served in prison[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSo if [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit does not deter crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, if [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit doesn't make us safer[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, why do we have the death penalty and why are we asking now?[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mFamilies and friends of the defendants can get serious psychological traumas While waiting for the final verdict, families of defendants live in a constant stress that can cause serious neurologic diseases[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mEven states with the fewest protections and a faster process face exorbitant death penalty costs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mFlorida estimated that it spends $51 million per year on the death penalty over what it would cost to punish all first degree murderers with life without parole[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn fact, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mstates without the death penalty consistently have lower homicide rates than those with the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHoule said [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mopposition to the death penalty is not about coddling criminal or setting them free to commit more crimes[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFurther, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty is not necessary to achieve the benefit of protecting the public from murderers who may strike again[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAfter careful study of the death penalty and its effects, a bipartisan majority of legislators concluded that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe only way to fix the death penalty is by ending it[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mDeath penalty costs are accrued upfront[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, especially at trial and for the early appeals, while [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe cost of life in prison are spread out over many decades[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mresearch has failed to provide scientific proof that executions have a greater deterrent effect than life imprisonment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe imperfections of the criminal justice system, of which any practitioner is well aware, cause many of us to be unable to ethically support a punishment that should demand infallibility[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mLife imprisonment without parole can be deterrent and can be more rehabilitative than the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mMore than two-thirds of world states have abolished the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and therefore Malaysia should join the ranks.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mOther than fairness related argument, Law and Economics believe that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mwrong judgment reduces the probability of allocating the criminal sanctions to the intended target[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, i.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIt is not a more effective deterrent than prison and makes worst the evil it pretends to cure[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, because [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mdeath penalty brutalizes and makes society more violent[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThere is an entire body of research that shows [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthere is no correlation between officer safety and implementation of a death penalty statute[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mI have argued in my working paper here, that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mimposing death penalty for rape cases might be counterproductive because the process of evidence is difficult and the administrative costs for getting the right decision would be too huge[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mCourt can‚Äôt always know if murderer can or can‚Äôt become better and feel sorry about his crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, so [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mpeople, who could become better, may not have an opportunity to prove it[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThey argue that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma government's act to execute is a violation of human rights, especially if there remains a possibility that the individual is innocent[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe death penalty is up to 70% more expensive to implement than comparable non-death penalty cases[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m a study in the US has concluded.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAdditionally, a 2012 survey of the current research on the death penalty and deterrence found that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthere was insufficient evidence to support any assertions that the threat of the death penalty reduces homicide rates[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe authors conclude that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe American death penalty system is seriously flawed[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and that, if used at all, capital punishment should be reserved for the very worst offenders and cases in which no doubt exists that the defendant committed the crime.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThere are strong proponents of the death penalty but [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mits efficacy and legitimacy remains a constant irritant[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m. "[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe New York Department of Correctional Services estimated that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mimplementing the death penalty would cost the state about $118 million annually[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe report found that from 1995 to 2000, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma white defendant was almost twice as likely as a black, Hispanic, or "other" defendant to be offered a plea agreement reducing the penalty to life imprisonment or less[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFeingold's bill would stop executions on the federal level, which are part [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mof a death penalty system that has proven to be ineffective, wrought with racial disparities, and alarmingly costly[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mNor is it just [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe appeals process that is expensive[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m: [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mcapital cases take extra security and capital trials cost extra, especially the two-stage sentencing process[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe added costs accrue because [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mseeking the death penalty at trial is more expensive than not seeking it at trial[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, regardless of the outcome.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMoney ‚Ä¢ [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mCalifornia currently spends $184 million on the death penalty each year and is on track to spend $1 billion in the next five years[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHistorically, nonwhites were likely to receive death-penalty sentences and were Argues that mentally [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mretarded offenders should not be put to death[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFor other nations that have abolished the death penalty, it might have been of monetary inclination because [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mof cost efficiency[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWe believe that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe abolition of the death penalty contributes to enhancement of human dignity and progressive development of human rights[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mA key study found that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe costs of the death penalty are borne primarily by increasing taxes and cutting services like police and highway funding[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, with county budgets bearing the brunt of the burden.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIt is unfair to those who have been sent to their death for a crime they did not commit and to those who have no sense of right and wrong after years of mental disabilities and abuse[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mgovernment spends millions of dollars paid for by the taxpayers, just to try to get a person killed[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe Death Penalty Information Center says, since 1973, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255m115 people in 25 states have been released from death row with evidence of their innocence[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, and [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe yearly average of exonerations has risen[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m from 3.08 from 1973 to 1998 to 7 since 1998.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIf the prosecution made decisions not to seek the death penalty, these cases could be substantially shortened[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m."[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWay of the [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmankind should reach peace and stability and deaths on its way are not admissible[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn short, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe effects that the death penalty has on our economic situation are devastating[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and the death penalty should be banned from use in the United States.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe belief that the death penalty lowers crime is indeed a myth, as the evidence shows[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAnd it is precisely that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255munpredictability and inconsistency in the judicial administration of the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m that is at the heart of the principled objections to the death penalty.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mBy abolishing the death penalty, in addition to more funds to help victims families, additional resources would be freed to help reduce violent crime before it happens[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mOn direct appeal, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe cost of appellate defense averaged $100,000 more in death penalty cases, than in non-death penalty murder cases[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIt is the burden of death penalty opponents to prove that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty, the most severe of criminal sanctions, is the only prospect of a negative outcome that deters none[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIn Kansas, the costs of capital cases are 70% more expensive than comparable non-capital cases[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, including the costs of incarceration.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe U.S., [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mas the only remaining Western country to regularly administer the death penalty, is in very bad company[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and the world knows it, even if many Americans don't, which decreases the legitimacy of the U.S. on human rights issues[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mUnlike other types of punishments (such as prison or jail), [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty is the only punishment with a mobilized opposition that continues to fight against its use[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mMany of the extra costs are legally mandated to reduce the risk of executing an innocent person, but even these safeguards are not enough[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255m16 million per execution over the costs of a non-death penalty murder case and estimated additional costs to the state associated with the death penalty at $4 million per year[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWe see a real openness to considering life with no possibility for parole as a punishment for murder and a real awareness among Americans [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mof the many problems with the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe life sentence is just as bad as a death sentence[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, so [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mwhy have the death penalty at all[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m?[39m[49m

[41m[38;2;255;255;255mStatistics show that the deathpenalty has no deterrent effect on crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIt might scare some people, but [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe vast majority of murders would kill anyway[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, for most murders are not rationalizing their actions.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSupporters say that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mfew innocent people are executed and DNA testing will make convictions safer Since 1973[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mover 130 people have been released from death rows throughout the country due to evidence of their wrongful convictions[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mPurely retributive in nature ‚Äî countless studies show that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit does not deter crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m ‚Äî [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty is unjust, uncivilized, and inconsistent with the fallibility of our justice system[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mInstead, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe relatives said, the alternative of life without parole might allow them to move on[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIf other states abolished the death penalty, law enforcement wouldn‚Äôt miss it and the cost savings could be used on more effective crime-fighting programs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m,‚Äù said Police Chief James Abbott of West Orange, New Jersey.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mClaims [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit is not fairly administered, does not deter people from committing murder, does not effect the conscience of children, and is the most costly way of dealing with criminal offenders[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mDieter says, is that since the late 1990s, more [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mpeople have become aware of ‚Äúhow many mistakes the system makes‚Äù ‚Äì especially as they‚Äôve seen death-row inmates and other prisoners released because of DNA evidence showing their innocence[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn this online essay, Phil Porter argues that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty is an inefficient method of deterring crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThat means that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mnow or in the future, a person improperly sentenced to death will likely be sitting on death row[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mFor a single death penalty trial, the state may pay $1million more than for a non-death penalty trial[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe death penalty is an ineffective and counter-productive way to punish terrorists[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHe feels that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit is unfair to charge someone for murder when they are in denial or mentally unstable[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe death penalty closes the door on any possibility of redemption and healing[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mDMN found that it costs [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255m$2.3 million per average death penalty case (for 5 cases), more than 3 times more expensive than a $750,000 life sentence[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMy point: In order to minimize wrongful executions [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe cost of capital murder cases leading to the deathpenalty are much more costly to taxpayers then cases leading to life in prison[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mToday [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe world is increasingly moving away from accepting the use of death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m with [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mtwo thirds of the world‚Äôs countries having already abolished the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m in law or in practice.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mBut [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mif, in fact, the death penalty does not deter, and we continue to impose it, we have only sacrificed the lives of convicted murderers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m"With many states spending millions to retain the death penalty, while seldom or never carrying out an execution, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty is turning into a very expensive form of life without parole[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSupreme Court Overturns Most Death Penalty LawsIn the 1972 case of Furman v. Georgia, 408 U.S. 153 (1972), [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe Supreme Court issued a 5-4 decision effectively striking down most federal and state death penalty laws finding them "arbitrary and capricious[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m."[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe cost alone should be enough to abolish capital punishment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m because [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mof the funds it dries up when more money could go towards crime prevention[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m....[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever some countries still favoured the counter-trend and it was crucial that the international community continue to undertake all possible efforts to protect [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe inherent right to life[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, to which there was no derogation.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe death penalty is a way to let the criminal off easy[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mSince 1973, 144 prisoners on death row have been found to be innocent of the crimes for which they were convicted[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThere are many other ways to punish criminals[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, but [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mdeath is not the answer[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mDeath penalty deprives criminals of one more chance[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m Death penalty is not about inhumanity only.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mProfessor Cotsirilos spoke of the many death penalty cases where the defendants were innocent ‚Äì and yet still suffered the ultimate penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mJohn Kitzhaber told reporters that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe death penalty is an "expensive, unworkable system that fails to meet the basic standards of justice[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m."[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m"[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mWhen the state, in our names and with our taxes, ends a human life despite having non-lethal alternatives, it suggests that society can overcome violence with violence[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMorally unjust Many death penalty opponents believe that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mstate-sanctioned killing is not a sensible way to show that killing is wrong does not make sense[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, and believe that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe government has no moral right to put people to death[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn a state-by-state analysis, The Times found that during the last 20 years, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe homicide rate in states with the death penalty has been 48 percent to 101 percent higher than in states without the death penalty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mGenerally speaking, polls suggest that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mAmericans do not see gun control as the solution to criminal violence[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, but they do believe that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255msignificant reductions in criminal violence are not possible without stricter gun laws[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[41m[38;2;255;255;255mOnly about one crime gun in every six is directly obtained through normal retail shops[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSo our [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mgun OWNERSHIP rate is ~22 times higher than it is in the Phillipines, yet their gun homicide rate is right in line with ours[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, despite massively fewer guns in civilian hands.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mGun control laws allow some people to vent their emotions, politicians to grandstand and self-righteous people to ‚Äúmake a statement‚Äù ‚Äî but all at the cost of other people‚Äôs lives[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThat being said, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthose who like lesser gun restrictions usually have more gun control statistics in their favor[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m because [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mthese statistics also are sometimes arbitrary and objective rather than carved into stone[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMany women (quite reasonably) fear the threat of attack by a physically stronger man, and [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma firearm could prevent many of these attacks[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, but [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mgun bans leave these women vulnerable[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe gun control lobby uses the crime argument as a ruse to cover their real agenda--the ultimate banning of private gun ownership among the citizens[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mWithout gun control people would be allowed to have firearms[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and then [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mcrime rates would decrease[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mWidespread gunownership in a community could provide a general deterrent to criminal predation[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, lowering the risk to owners and non-owners alike.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIn 1954, there were only a dozen armed robberies in London, but by the 1990s ‚Äì after decades of ever-tightening gun-ownership restrictions ‚Äì there were more than a hundred times as many armed robberies[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAfter all, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mif they‚Äôre going to violate a law against murder, which has an extremely high penalty attached to it, why would they give a hoot about complying with a gun-control law[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m?[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIt may be said that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mif criminals know their victims are unarmed they are less likely to be afraid of committing a criminal act against them[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mOwners of the 166,000 estimated semi-automatic rifles in the state could lose their guns[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mConversely, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mstate laws forcing law-abiding citizens to store their weapons unloaded, or with various other restrictions, have been followed by increases in violent crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m -- not decreases, as predicted.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMyth #8 : ‚Äú[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mCriminals don‚Äôt bother with gun control[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, what we need is crime control.‚Äù[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mBut [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255manything that seems designed more to deter people from getting guns than at assuring their safe use will be invalidated[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThey should accept the reality that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255msupport for guns remains strong[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and work for a bipartisan ‚Äúgrand compromise‚Äù that offers gun owners substantive benefits in exchange for reasonable gun restrictions.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSo [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255meven if Arizona outlawed firearms Jared Loughner would have still gotten a gun[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m(False) [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mStudies show that more gun ownership results in less crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, but [[[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mliberals]] push gun control because it increases the dependency of voters on government for protection[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSpecific [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mexamples of guns being used successfully in [[self-defense]] are easy to find[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMany argue [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mguns protect us as United States citizens[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, while others will argue that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mguns are killing United States citizens[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThey have also stated [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255m‚Äúa crime victim that has a gun is way better off than one that does not have one‚Äù[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m (Balanced).[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mBy law, BATF cannot create centralized databases of the disposition of firearms, which greatly reduces its overall effectiveness[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThat would have to be weighed against [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe lives saved when widespread gun ownership reduces violent crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAnother shocking detail is that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe number of suicides is higher in regions that have a lower number of gun owning people[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn reality, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mif guns were taken away, more violence would occur and it would leave potential victims defenseless against criminals who have ways of obtaining weapons[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mMany people who have never fired a gun in their lives, and never faced life-threatening dangers, nevertheless feel qualified to impose legal restrictions that can be fatal to others[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m'''[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mGun control''' laws restrict the purchase or ownership of guns, even though guns are typically acquired for defensive and/or sporting purposes[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[41m[38;2;255;255;255mGun control laws allow some people to vent their emotions, politicians to grandstand and self-righteous people to ‚Äúmake a statement‚Äù ‚Äì but all at the cost of other people's lives[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWhile [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe Brady background check is easily circumvented[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255many further attempts to extend gun control--for instance, through comprehensive licensing of all gun owners and registration of all guns--would pose monumental administrative burdens[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe Fallacy and Motivation for Gun Control Gun control potentially causes an increase in crime by restricting its main deterrent: self-defense[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mArguments on the other side include the claim that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mcitizens who are issued concealed weapons permits are substantially less likely than the average person to use a gun to commit a crime[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mNOW It has now been 12 months since gun owners in Australia were forced by new law to surrender 640,381 personal firearms to be destroyed by their own government, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma program costing Australia taxpayers more than $500 million dollars[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mGun Control won't stop the bad guys[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThis excellent documentary effectively shatters gun control myths[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and fallacies.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mGun control simply disarms their potential victims, making crime a safer occupation[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, and hence one that can be indulged in more widely by more people.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWith so many variations and so many sources of evidence available, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255msurely there would be some compelling evidence somewhere if tighter gun-control laws actually reduced the murder rate[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMyth #4 : ‚Äú[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mGun control ‚Äòpunishes‚Äô law abiding gun owners and farmers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.‚Äù[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mEven if guns encourage or facilitate crime, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mguns potentially prevent crime by giving criminals reason to worry that victims might shoot back[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIf gun control becomes prohibition, the potential for adverse effects is large[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMost obviously, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthey help people feel physically safe[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThus, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmany Southern States imposed high taxes or banned inexpensive guns so as to price blacks and poor whites out of the gun market[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever, the problem with this position by gun control supporters is that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthere is no evidence to show that any of their laws have ever reduced crime or violence[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmost of the arguments used for gun control are the result of careful manipulation of data and emotional appeal[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mGuns do not have a mind of their own[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, and [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mif there are owners, who fail to act responsibly, do not punish those who are responsible when owning guns[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThey believe that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mlegalizing marijuana would be like legalizing something considered to be a death sentence[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m but they have no issues with alcohol and nicotine consumption even though it kills people and is way more addictive than marijuana.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m"[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mFor adolescents and young adults alike it can become a gateway drug[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, introducing them to the harrowing world of illegal drugs and the criminals who produce and distribute them.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFurthermore, the medical science is clear: [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mMarijuana use has deleterious effects on health and behavior[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, especially among the young.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe Anti-Legalization Those that think legalizing marijuana is a bad idea believe [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthat there is nothing good or beneficial about marijuana[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m at all.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mKleiman often argues that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mwhile marijuana is in many respects less harmful than alcohol, it does pose public health concerns, and that the large-scale commercialization of marijuana could greatly increase its use and abuse[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mEssentially, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mlegalization means cheaper drugs and more availability, which equals more use[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mNearly half (49 percent) of Americans believe that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255musing marijuana is morally acceptable[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, while 4-in-10 (40 percent) say that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmarijuana use is morally wrong[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThough some discount [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit as a harmful substance[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, there are many others who worry about [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mincreased criminal behavior[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255maddiction and other health problems that can arise from its use[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m....[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255m1 in 10 people who try marijuana will become addicted to it[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, developing a dependence that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mproduces withdrawal, cravings[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, etc.[39m[49m
[42m[38;2;255;255;255mMinimum wage also protects younger workers and minorities from being paid less than others to some extent[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe problem with that argument is that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mvery few poor people are earning the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mvery few people who do earn the minimum wage are poor[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mBut even if [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wage policies reduce inequality and improve the functioning of low-wage labor markets[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, are [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthere better alternatives when it comes to helping low-income families[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m?[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mCombine this with changes to the tax system that allow low-income earners to keep more of their earnings, and [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mlower income earners are given a solid foundation to build upon[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mCohorts of minimum wage say that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mit intensifies the ordinary of living of employees, decreases poverty, and forces companies to be more proficient[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAs Tom Lehman pointed out in his piece, the main reason that there appears that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mthe minimum wage has a relatively small effect on unemployment in general[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m is that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mnot every worker is affected by the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mCertainly, [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mthose who earn between the current minimum wage and the new minimum wage would be directly affected and see their wages increase[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m* [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mRaising the minimum wage will help families and individuals struggling to get by and working more for less[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mArgues that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255memployment losses from higher minimum wages have been overstated[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mmuch of the higher unemployment among minority youth has been due to cyclical factors[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[42m[38;2;255;255;255mIt controls for differences across the minimum wage states[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m in the size of minimum wage increases, in the number of minimum wage increases, and in the timing of minimum wage increases.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mNick Hanauer has made an economic argument: [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mA rising minimum wage will lift all boats, giving greater buying power to low-wage workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe spectacular failure of mortgage refinancing and credit card debt to sustain consumer spending over the past decade is a reminder that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mgood jobs at good wages are vital for grounding our economy and driving consumer demand[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThus, [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mhigher minimum wages might offer modest gains to the substantial number of low-skilled workers who get jobs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, but [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mimpose substantial economic injury on those who can‚Äôt[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAlthough there is some debate about how much the minimum wage affects employment, the typical study finds that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma 10 percent increase in the minimum wage depresses teenage employment between 1 and 3 percent[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mBut even these studies often show that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255memployers substitute higher-skilled workers for disadvantaged workers when the minimum wage rises[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAdditionally, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mincreasing the minimum wage will inspire technology to eliminate some jobs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe minimum wage makes it harder for home grown and local businesses to compete against foreign companies who have the benefit of cheaper labour costs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever, many critics of the minimum wage system believe that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma minimum wage is incapable of supporting a worker and actually harms the economy[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIf you were due a rate greater than minimum wage, but had a minimum wage claim because little or no wages were paid, your penalty could be greater[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn these tough economic conditions, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255memployers are simply not going to hire workers whose labor produces less than the cost of hiring them[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe Erosion of the Entry-Level Job Market: Minimum Wage Increases and their Impact on Minimum Wage Workers Content Economic research has extensively documented that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mteen jobs are lost as an unintended consequence of a higher minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mTo avoid increasing total compensation, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255memployers react to arbitrary boosts in money wages by cutting other benefits[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mA minimum-wage law is, in reality, a law that makes it illegal for an employer to hire a person with limited skills[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSherk noted, "[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe minimum wage especially hurts disadvantaged workers' job prospects[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m. Higher minimum wages encourage employers to replace less-skilled workers with more productive employees.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mConclusion Far from giving disadvantaged workers a leg up, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mraising the minimum wage cuts off the bottom rung of the career ladder for many lower-skilled workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThis video (at the 1:15 through 1:31 point) says that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mincreasing the minimum wage will slow the economy because manufacturers have less to reinvest[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mConclude that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wages reduced employment opportunities for workers by reducing the number of low-wage jobs and the number of hours worked[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSimilarly, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255msingle parents would disproportionately benefit from a higher minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m: 10.4 percent of those who would be affected are single parents, higher than their 7.5 percent share of the workforce.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mClearly, if the employer was receiving that value in labor, free market competition would force them to pay the wage for that labor[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mOnly some minimum wage workers will remain employed and receive more wages at the expense of others who will be laid off or not hired to begin with[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAs University of California economics professor David Neumark says, "[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThere is no research supporting the claim that minimum wages reduce the proportion of families living in poverty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m."[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn turn, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255memployers will respond by reducing their workforce, hiring fewer workers and reducing hours of work for existing employees[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mNeumark and Wascher found that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wage hikes increased the probability that poor families escaped poverty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m but [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255malso increased the probability that previously non-poor families fell below the poverty line[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m‚Äú[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIt's anti-business[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit will curb economic development[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit will cost jobs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m,‚Äù he said, adding that he thinks a minimum wage bill will pass because the governor and Democratic majority support it.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mResearchers have found that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wage hikes reduce the earnings and job prospects of affected workers for over a decade after they are passed[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIt is likely that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma much higher minimum wage, one that is closer to the living wage recommendation, would be more disruptive to employers and likely have more negative impacts[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFinds that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe minimum wage has reduced employment, especially among teenagers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m; [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit has made teenagers more vulnerable to the business cycle; and has forced teenagers out of covered occupations into those not covered by the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mStudy concludes that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe real concern among small businesses is not that their low-wage workers earn too much, but that their customers earn too little[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThere one finds broad agreement that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe minimum wage causes unemployment among low-skilled workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAlternately, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthey could spend more time increasing their skills in university, which would make them more suitable for higher-paying jobs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, as well as provide numerous other benefits.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mNot all unskilled job applicants precluded from minimum wage jobs end up unemployed[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, or (another neglected effect) as discouraged labor force dropouts.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMoreover, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mfewer than 5% of workers in countries like Canada and the US earn the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, implying that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255many direct negative effects of a minimum-wage increase are unlikely to be widespread[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m (e.g. Neumark et al. 2004).[39m[49m

[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe more small competitors of Wal-Mart either forced to raise prices or go out of business as a result of the minimum wage hike only aids Wal-Mart's competitive advantage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMore importantly, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthey measure substantial drops in wage growth in the second year following a mandated wage hike[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe exception being that in those competitive industries, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mbusinesses will try to offset the higher cost of wages with new technologies to reduce the reliance on low-skilled workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever, since very few people actually earn the minimum wage, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mevaluating its effect on total employment levels is bound to generally yield small numbers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAs noted above, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mworkers who earn wages somewhat above the new minimum wage would be indirectly affected[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m by a minimum wage increase.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWhile over 100 Democrats helped to introduce the bill in the House of Representatives during the summer to raise the minimum wage, most Republicans will likely argue that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe fragile economy prohibits such a drastic change to the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[41m[38;2;255;255;255mRaising the Minimum Wage Will Not Reduce Poverty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m About the Author Supporters of raising the minimum wage argue that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mdoing so will reduce poverty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWhile some critics argue that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mwith the country mired in recession and plagued by high unemployment rates, now is not the time for an increase[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mOther critics, such as the Canadian Federation of Independent Businesses, contend that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wage laws actually hurt the very people they purport to help by causing unemployment for low skilled workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe idea that an increase in the minimum wage automatically makes all workers better off and that overall consumption (aggregate demand) will drive the economy is upside-down[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m economics.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAward winning [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mresearch looked at states that raised their minimum wage between 2003 and 2007 and found no evidence to suggest these higher minimum wages reduced poverty rates[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMoreover, even if [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mmany workers affected by a higher minimum wage would see increased wages[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and suffer neither reductions in employment nor hours, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wages may do little or nothing to help poor and low-income families[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAlthough the bill does not adjust the tip credit percentages, the bill's [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wage increases will increase the amount these employers must pay[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSince [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmany low-wage workers live in high-income families, increasing the minimum wage is an ineffective way of increasing the incomes of poor families[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIf you own a restaurant, a proposed minimum wage increase could affect your tipped employees' wages as well[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThus, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mfor low-paid employees with health insurance, a $1 per hour increase in the minimum wage could result in a $1 per hour decrease in employer-provided health insurance[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mArgues that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe minimum wage prevents many young people from accepting jobs that would provide them with on-the-job training, thus contributing to long-term unemploy- ment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThey claimed that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mincreases in minimum wage rates for those undertaking training, including on-the-job training, would deter many employers from offering training opportunities to young people[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSince 2000, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mstates at or below the federal minimum wage have grown jobs faster than states with higher minimum wages in those years[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mA lot of attention gets paid to the [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mlong-term, negative effects that inflation has on the purchasing power of the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mEmployees have not yet realized the downside of minimum wage because the economy is still relatively strong[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, where average wage tends to be higher than the statutory minimum wage.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mDespite the fact that the federal government neglected the minimum wage, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe strong economy of the late 1990s boosted the wages of low-wage workers, reversing some of the effects of inflation on the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThis requirement has resulted in a minor cost increase for employers and a 2.2 percent decrease in employment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn fact, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mas federal minimum wages increase, these workers become a larger share of the minimum wage workforce as they crowd out those workers with fewer skills[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mSetting a minimum wage can lead to increased mechanisation in the manufacturing industry as the cost of installing and maintaining machines is cheaper than paying the minimum wage to employees[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFiscal conservatives tend to oppose increases in the minimum wage because [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255min a free market, the price of labor, like any other commodity, should be set by negotiations between the buyer and seller without undue interference from the state[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mMinimum Wages Reduce School Enrollment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m Contrary to the rhetoric of those who favor raising the minimum wage, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmost people affected by the minimum wage are actually young workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWe can [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mexpect that industries that employ a lot of low-skilled workers will grow more slowly, if at all, after the minimum wage is increased[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mMany poor Americans are unemployed and are obviously not helped by increasing the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIf [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mlow-skill jobs become less available, the bottom rung on the employment ladder becomes less available to low-skilled workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn some cases [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mlabor contracts require rates of pay that are linked to the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, but even in the absence of such contracts [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255memployers often increase wages for other workers in order to maintain overall pay scales[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIt is often argued that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wage increases can lead to increased inflation[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThese estimates overstate the gains to households from increasing the minimum wage because, to the extent they are able, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255memployers will offset the higher minimum wage by reducing non-money components of worker compensation[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mAmong the three states with lower minimum wages, growth has varied New Hampshire, with the lowest minimum wage has seen some employment growth, but two other states with lower minimum wages have had further job loss[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever, some [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mstudies find that decreasing the minimum wage for unskilled long-term unemployed people would increase employment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mStandard microeconomic theory predicts that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mincreasing the minimum wage will reduce employment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mBenefits and Disadvantages [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mFlexible labour markets involve a minimum of government intervention[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, they are labour markets which work efficiently and are competitive.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mKersey argues that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mwages in a market economy will rise as demand rises[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, so [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthere is no need to artifically increase the wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn other words, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma minimum wage household with two children has their effective wage rate and purchasing power increased by 55 percent when all forms of public assistance are considered[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mShawn Fremstad at CEPR explains why even after tax credits like the EITC, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma $9 minimum wage still would fall short of keeping all families out of poverty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSome stakeholders also said [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthere is no need for parliament to come up with a law on minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, arguing that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe current provisions on minimum wage are sufficient[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and only needed amendment.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mNo matter how you cut it, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255msomebody worse-off than the employee ends up paying for the increased (above market) wages[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIt is worth keeping in mind, however, that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma higher federal wage floor might make it harder for states with large numbers of less-skilled workers to increase employment levels over time[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe legal restriction that employers cannot pay less than [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma legislated wage is equivalent to the legal restriction that workers cannot work at all in the protected sector[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m unless they can find employers willing to hire them at that wage.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wage tends to hurt the lowest skilled workers by making them less employable[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFinds that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma 10% increase in the minimum wage will reduce teenage employment by 1.2% overall[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, with smaller declines in services and retail trade and a higher impact in manufacturing.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mYet "[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthere is no evidence that minimum wages raise the amount of training obtained by workers to qualify for their current job[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, and, indeed, there is some evidence that minimum wages reduce this kind of training as well."[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThus, at that time, there was a general consensus among economists that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mincreases in the minimum wage would cause job loss and may be bad for its intended beneficiaries[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn its brief submitted to the Court of Appeal, ACORN argued, "[39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe more that ACORN must pay each individual outreach worker‚Äîeither because of minimum wage or overtime requirements‚Äîthe fewer outreach workers it will be able to hire[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m."[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIf the minimum wage reduces profitability below the normal level, the number of businesses and investment in affected industries may shrink over time until normal returns are restored[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mAn increase in the minimum wage will not benefit all low income workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAt this age, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mwork experience is usually slight[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, and [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mfew have had much chance to develop skills and work habits that would enable them to command high wages[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe effect of minimum wage increases on employment A common argument against raising the minimum wage is that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mwage increases will reduce employment because firms will be forced to lay off workers in order to compensate for the wage hikes[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mAmong people who do work, only a tiny fraction of them are employed in minimum wage jobs, and many of those are teenagers from middle-class families[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThis is because, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mas the wage rate rises, it becomes more expensive for firms to hire workers and so firms hire fewer workers (or hire them for fewer hours[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m).[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mBased on this theory, some economists instinctively oppose the minimum wage because they believe that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mraising cost of labor through a minimum wage increase will cause employers to hire fewer low-wage workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn fact, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mfewer than a third of minimum-wage earners are in families with incomes below the poverty line[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever, when adjusted for inflation, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe new federal minimum is still less than the minimum wage through most of the period from 1961 to 1981[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mMinimum wage laws mandate high wages for low-wage workers, rather than higher earnings for low-income families[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever, their problem, politically, is that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe loss of jobs due to a higher minimum wage comes almost exclusively from the loss of jobs that otherwise would be created[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mBut because [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum-wage legislation reduces low-skilled-workers‚Äô job opportunities across the board, workers are less able to shift jobs from their current employers to other employers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFor all its advocates' good intentions, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mraising the minimum wage will not reduce poverty in America[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThus, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mif the minimum wage rises by 1 percent, and 10 percent of workers at a given percentile are paid the minimum wage, the observed wage percentile will rise by 0[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mLandburg argues that a more appropriate reason for opposition to the minimum wage is that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit is designed to provide a transfer of income from either customers or business owners to low-wage worker[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mWhen employers switch to hiring more skilled workers, they make it more difficult for disadvantaged workers to get entry-level jobs and start to climb the career ladder[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIn fact, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mgiven the erosion of the value of the minimum wage over the last 15 years it is now much less of a mandate on businesses and the public sector than it used to be[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFinds that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mextension of the minimum wage to farm workers has increased wages but reduced employment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThird, they contend that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe minimum wage is not well targeted, with most of the benefits accruing to teenagers and families that already have relatively high income levels[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mOpponents of the minimum wage argue that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mif firms could pay less it would leads to a jump in employment of people who are made unemployed by the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe fact that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255msome in the lowest income bracket will gain slightly from minimum wages[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m (by having their wages raised) while [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mothers will lose significantly[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m (from losing their jobs) means that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wages can be seen as increasing inequality[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mConfirms that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mhigher minimum wage rates reduce youth employment and increases youth unemployment rates[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, especially for nonwhite males.[39m[49m

[41m[38;2;255;255;255m10 would kill the economy and make even more people without jobs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m because [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mmost companies have a certain amount of money that they can spend on employing people[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mUnshielded from any adverse employment effects of the minimum wage, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mteenagers and young adults are considered un-usually susceptible to employment losses in the face of minimum wage increases[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAlthough the law sets minimum wages, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe legally mandated minimum wage for most unskilled and semiskilled workers is not always paid[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSome studies find that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe adverse employment impact is greater for certain groups such as low-skilled workers and teenagers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, but this too is a matter of contention.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHowever, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mincreasing the minimum wage tends to have limited impacts on wage differentials[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mDuring the first part of this period, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255min the 1990s, all sectors including those with a high concentration of minimum wage workers experienced roughly similar growth levels, despite implementation of a higher minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWith many workers forced into minimum-wage jobs by the recession, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mit is a particularly difficult time for even a small reduction in pay[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mIf there were an increase in the minimum wage, the direct effect of raising the minimum to $3.48 ([39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255ma 5% increase) would affect no employees, therefore no increase in the in the hourly wage income and the average hourly wage would remain at $6.71 per hour[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m (see Appendix B).[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mBecause they earn between the current and the next minimum wage, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255memployers must either raise their wages or lay them off after the next rise in the minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mHe suggests that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255man increase in the minimum wage would reduce employment for low-wage workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe conventional wisdom among economists is that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wages are bad because they "artificially" lower demand for low-wage labor, by making it more expensive, thereby leading to a loss of low-wage employment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mLately, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mopponents of the minimum wage have suggested that decreasing it would help to boost employment[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAssuming that [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mlarge corporations would shed no jobs thanks to a hike in a minimum wage[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255myou also have to consider the effect that this would have on the competitiveness of the small businesses that employ the other one-third[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mWhen businesses have to pay higher wages, businesses hire higher-skill workers, freezing the least productive, most disadvantaged workers out of the job market[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSo, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe job-destroying effects of a minimum wage increase falls particularly hard on low-skilled workers[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFinds that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe minimum wage has been ineffective in reducing income inequality[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mOf course, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255meven if the effects on employment are small, that doesn't mean it'll do much to reduce poverty[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIf the repeal of the exemption that affected more than 6 percent of the nation's hourly workers substantially reduces the number of uncovered jobs, then overt unemployment caused by the minimum wage could become a more serious problem[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWhile the minimum wage is often pushed as an anti-poverty tool, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthere is no compelling evidence that the minimum wage on balance helps poor families, though some poor families might be better off at the expense of others[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[41m[38;2;255;255;255mThe Government should direct resources to provide greater access to vocational training and employment incentives[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m, particularly for young and less skilled people.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mWith no alternative employment options available‚Äîvery few businesses, large or small, are exempt from a higher state [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mminimum wage‚Äîteens who were previously working at minimum wage jobs are confronted with larger employment losses[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMyth: [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mIncreasing the minimum wage will cause people to lose their jobs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThose who object to increasing the minimum wage point out that doing so [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mdoesn‚Äôt target its benefits to working poor adults ‚Äì most of those in minimum-wage jobs are young people in transitional jobs[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mMyth: [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mRaising the minimum wage hurts the poor by causing job loss[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThe effect on this group of low-wage workers would be less immediate and more modest; and [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mnot every low wage worker might benefit for instance someone earning just below $11.00 per hour[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m might not see a wage increase following a minimum wage increase to $10.00 per hour, while someone else currently earning slightly more than $11.00 per hour might receive an increase.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSo when a new minimum-wage law orders Acme to pay its workers more, thereby squeezing profit margins, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mthe company will respond in the only way it can: by hiring fewer workers, or giving its workers fewer hours[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mAs the fuel (fissionable uranium, [.sup.235]U) [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255min the rods of a typical nuclear reactor decays, the concentrations of other dangerous radioisotopes rises[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m (Botkin and Keller 2011).[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mFrom what has been discussed above, it is easy to identify that [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255msolar energy is more promising than nuclear energy for its pollution-free production, safety, and convenience[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSo, [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mvery large place is needed to store the nuclear waste[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m and [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255mnew sites would need to be found to store the future nuclear waste[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[42m[38;2;255;255;255mThey are practical[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m ([39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mthey certainly saved me and my parents the time and hassle of figuring out what to wear[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m every morning).[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mTheir [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255mschool uniforms are wrinkle and soil resistant, making them able to be worn frequently with little maintenance[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mThus, [39m[49m[42m[38;2;255;255;255ma mandatory uniform can impede the ability of gangs to distinguish themselves[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m

[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0mSpecial clothes like [39m[49m[41m[38;2;255;255;255muniforms are only produced in small quantities, and so are more costly than normal clothes[39m[49m[48;2;200;200;200m[38;2;0;0;0m.[39m[49m
